Public Overrides Function AddNewPart(Of T As OpenXmlPart) (contentType As String, id As String) As T

Docs.param: The content type of the part. Must match the defined content type if the part is fixed content type.
The relationship id. The id will be automaticly generated if this param is null.
Docs.summary: Adds a new part of type .
Docs.remarks: Mainly used for adding not-fixed content type part - ImagePart, etc
Docs.exception: When the part is not allowed to be referenced by this part.
When the part is fixed content type and the passed in contentType does not match the defined content type.
Thrown when "contentType" is null reference.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.WordprocessingDocument CreateFromTemplate(string path) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateFromTemplate (path As String) As WordprocessingDocument

Docs.param: The path and file name of the template.
Docs.summary: Creates an editable WordprocessingDocument from a template, opened on a MemoryStream with expandable capacity. The template will be attached to the WordprocessingDocument.
Docs.returns: The new WordprocessingDocument based on and linked to the template.
Docs.remarks: Attaching the template has been chosen as the default behavior because this is also what happens when a document is created from a template (other than Normal.dotm) using Microsoft Word.

MemberSignature.Value: public static DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.WordprocessingDocument CreateFromTemplate (string path, bool isTemplateAttached);
.method public static hidebysig class DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.WordprocessingDocument CreateFromTemplate(string path, bool isTemplateAttached) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateFromTemplate (path As String, isTemplateAttached As Boolean) As WordprocessingDocument

Docs.param: The path and file name of the template.
True, if the template should be attached to the document.
Docs.summary: Creates an editable WordprocessingDocument from a template, opened on a MemoryStream with expandable capacity.
Docs.returns: The new WordprocessingDocument based on and linked to the template.
Docs.remarks: This method is provided to offer the choice to not attach the template. When templates are attached in Microsoft Word, for example, the absolute path will be used in the relationship. These absolute paths are most often user-specific, however, so once documents are shared with other users, the relationship gets "broken" anyhow.
